meanings.definition: A person who wields power or influence.
meanings.sent1: The swayers in the story were the wise elders who made important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The political swayers in the government had the ability to shape laws and policies.
meanings.sent3: The swayers at the school meeting were the parents who suggested a pizza party for the students.
meanings.sent4: She was the swayer of the household, always guiding her family with love and care.
meanings.sent5: The swayers of the community were respected for their leadership and kindness.

meanings.definition: A device used for measuring or controlling movement.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a swayer to check the alignment of the wheels.
meanings.sent2: The swayer on the conveyor belt ensured that the boxes moved smoothly along the line.
meanings.sent3: The swayer beeped loudly when the elevator reached the top floor, surprising the passengers.
meanings.sent4: The swayer on the treadmill helped the runner track their progress during the workout.
meanings.sent5: The swayer on the clock controlled the ticking motion, keeping time accurately.

meanings.definition: A group of people who govern or control a country or organization.
meanings.sent1: The swayers of the company met to discuss the budget for the upcoming year.
meanings.sent2: The swayers of the nation worked together to address important issues facing the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The swayers at the charity event were the volunteers who organized the donation drive.
meanings.sent4: The swayers of the soccer team strategized before the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The swayers of the council made decisions that impacted the entire community.
